guide.conclusion: Thanks for sharing your Instructables with the Make: Projects community. We're glad to have you with us, and we know Instructables is, too.
guide.introduction: Many authors have contacted us asking for advice about the easiest way to duplicate their Instructables here on Make: Projects. The two platforms, though similar, each have some quirks, and don't share a common format. Fortunately, there is a way to eliminate most of the tedious cutting-and-pasting using Make: Projects "bulk import steps" feature.
guide.introduction_rendered: Many authors have contacted us asking for advice about the easiest way to duplicate their Instructables here on Make: Projects. The two platforms, though similar, each have some quirks, and don't share a common format. Fortunately, there is a way to eliminate most of the tedious cutting-and-pasting using Make: Projects "bulk import steps" feature.

steps.title: Download the PDF version of your Instructable

lines.text: Log in to your Instructables account.
lines.text_raw: Log in to your Instructables account.

lines.text: Select the "Instructables" tab.
lines.text_raw: Select the "Instructables" tab.

lines.text: Click the (edit) link next to the Instructable you want to migrate.
lines.text_raw: Click the (edit) link next to the Instructable you want to migrate.

lines.text: Select the "Share" tab.
lines.text_raw: Select the "Share" tab.

lines.text: Click "Download PDF Version" at the bottom of the frame.
lines.text_raw: Click "Download PDF Version" at the bottom of the frame.

lines.text: In the open PDF window, select all the text beginning with "Step 1" and ending with the last character in the last line of the last step.  Copy the selection to the clipboard.
lines.text_raw: In the open PDF window, select all the text beginning with "Step 1" and ending with the last character in the last line of the last step.  Copy the selection to the clipboard.

lines.text: Open the text editor of your choice and paste the clipboard selection into a new file.
lines.text_raw: Open the text editor of your choice and paste the clipboard selection into a new file.

lines.text: Our "bulk import" feature recognizes steps and instructions as shown in the accompanying pictures:
lines.text_raw: Our "bulk import" feature recognizes steps and instructions as shown in the accompanying pictures:

lines.text: "Step N: Name of Step" on a line by itself indicates a new step, and its title.
lines.text_raw: "Step N: Name of Step" on a line by itself indicates a new step, and its title.

lines.text: Every paragraph until a new "Step N:" header will become an instruction in the current step, up to a maximum of seven.
lines.text_raw: Every paragraph until a new "Step N:" header will become an instruction in the current step, up to a maximum of seven.

lines.text: Add blank lines between steps.
lines.text_raw: Add blank lines between steps.

lines.text: Text pasted from an Instructables .PDF will have the "footer" URLs, which are automatically inserted on each page of the .PDF, interspersed throughout.  It is easily removed using your text editor's find/replace function.
lines.text_raw: Text pasted from an Instructables .PDF will have the "footer" URLs, which are automatically inserted on each page of the .PDF, interspersed throughout.  It is easily removed using your text editor's find/replace function.

lines.text: Pasting from a .PDF can result in the addition of unwanted carriage returns inside paragraphs.  These should be removed, so that each instruction is a single paragraph without carriage returns.
lines.text_raw: Pasting from a .PDF can result in the addition of unwanted carriage returns inside paragraphs.  These should be removed, so that each instruction is a single paragraph without carriage returns.

steps.title: Bulk import your steps to Make: Projects

lines.text: Start a new Make: Project by clicking on "Contribute" at the top of the page.  Enter the title and select at least a primary category for your project as normal.
lines.text_raw: Start a new Make: Project by clicking on "Contribute" at the top of the page.  Enter the title and select at least a primary category for your project as normal.

lines.text: In the right-hand sidebar, open the "Meta Guide Data" drop-down and click on "Add tools."
lines.text_raw: In the right-hand sidebar, open the "Meta Guide Data" drop-down and click on "Add tools."

lines.text: Scroll down to the bottom of the blue "Meta Data" tab and click "Bulk import steps."  This will open a blank form field.
lines.text_raw: Scroll down to the bottom of the blue "Meta Data" tab and click "Bulk import steps."  This will open a blank form field.

lines.text: Paste the clipboard text from Notepad into this field.  Click "Save" immediately below.  Your project should now contain the correct number of steps, with each paragraph set off in a bullet point.
lines.text_raw: Paste the clipboard text from Notepad into this field.  Click "Save" immediately below.  Your project should now contain the correct number of steps, with each paragraph set off in a bullet point.

lines.text: Page through the steps in the edit pane, looking for copy and formatting errors.  Verify that all instructions were imported correctly.
lines.text_raw: Page through the steps in the edit pane, looking for copy and formatting errors.  Verify that all instructions were imported correctly.

lines.text: Expand the "Images" tab at the bottom of any page in the editing interface.
lines.text_raw: Expand the "Images" tab at the bottom of any page in the editing interface.

lines.text: Click on the "Upload" link inside the "Images" tab.
lines.text_raw: Click on the "Upload" link inside the "Images" tab.

lines.text: Click on "Browse Files" and select the original images used in your Instructable from your hard drive, then click on "Open."
lines.text_raw: Click on "Browse Files" and select the original images used in your Instructable from your hard drive, then click on "Open."

lines.text: Wait a moment while Make: Projects uploads and parses your image files.
lines.text_raw: Wait a moment while Make: Projects uploads and parses your image files.

lines.text: Images posted to Make: Projects must be 800x600 pixels, at minimum.  If any of your images are smaller than this, they will need to be scaled up, or positioned on larger canvases, before they will be accepted by the uploader.
lines.text_raw: Images posted to Make: Projects must be 800x600 pixels, at minimum.  If any of your images are smaller than this, they will need to be scaled up, or positioned on larger canvases, before they will be accepted by the uploader.

lines.text: Images posted to Make: Projects must be "landscapes," and must have a 4:3 aspect ratio.  You will be given an opportunity to crop images, as needed, after they have uploaded.
lines.text_raw: Images posted to Make: Projects must be "landscapes," and must have a 4:3 aspect ratio.  You will be given an opportunity to crop images, as needed, after they have uploaded.

lines.text: When all the image uploads are complete, click "Done" in the image uploading pop-up.
lines.text_raw: When all the image uploads are complete, click "Done" in the image uploading pop-up.

lines.text: Go through the steps of the project and add images to the appropriate steps, as usual, by dragging thumbnails from the image tab to each step's gallery.
lines.text_raw: Go through the steps of the project and add images to the appropriate steps, as usual, by dragging thumbnails from the image tab to each step's gallery.

lines.text: Be sure to click "Save" on each step after you've assigned images.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to click "Save" on each step after you've assigned images.

lines.text: As before, bring up the project's "meta" pane by clicking on "Add tools" under the "Meta Guide Data" tab in the right sidebar.
lines.text_raw: As before, bring up the project's "meta" pane by clicking on "Add tools" under the "Meta Guide Data" tab in the right sidebar.

lines.text: Estimate the time required to complete your project and type it in the appropriate field.
lines.text_raw: Estimate the time required to complete your project and type it in the appropriate field.

lines.text: Add "Tools" and materials ("Parts") individually, as needed.
lines.text_raw: Add "Tools" and materials ("Parts") individually, as needed.

lines.text: If your Instructable has a conclusion, it can be copied out of the .PDF and pasted into the "Conclusion" field.
lines.text_raw: If your Instructable has a conclusion, it can be copied out of the .PDF and pasted into the "Conclusion" field.

lines.text: Copy and paste the  introduction text from your Instructable PDF into the "Introduction" field under General Guide Data.
lines.text_raw: Copy and paste the  introduction text from your Instructable PDF into the "Introduction" field under General Guide Data.

lines.text: Come up with a pithy "tag line" for your project and enter it in the "Summary" field.  Shorter is better!  Aim for six words or less!
lines.text_raw: Come up with a pithy "tag line" for your project and enter it in the "Summary" field.  Shorter is better!  Aim for six words or less!

lines.text: Remove the "In Progress" flag by clicking on the "(remove)" link beside it.
lines.text_raw: Remove the "In Progress" flag by clicking on the "(remove)" link beside it.

lines.text: Set your project to "Publish" by clicking the bottom check-box.
lines.text_raw: Set your project to "Publish" by clicking the bottom check-box.

lines.text: Click the green "Save" button, and you're done!
lines.text_raw: Click the green "Save" button, and you're done!
